Description: Faience lentoid flask; moulded; flaring neck with everted rim (chipped); originally with two vertical handles from below rim to shoulder, now missing; traces of greenish blue glaze and brown black painted decoration of two concentric circles framing radiating lotus flowers on broad faces; row of chevrons on narrow sides.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 169)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P45, Fig 71)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: October 2012-February 2013, Belgium, Brussels, Cinquantenaire Museum, 'Ancient Cyprus'
